channel.title: How?
channel.description:
So, if I host a server, how the hell would I try to gain players? The MoparScape Server Status page is no choice, since there are eight sponsored servers that receive all the traffic and other server status pages aren't effective.
Regard, Jason~

item.title: How?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:28, topic:365257”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=461461.msg3375844#msg3375844 date=1287611189]
Domain is $10 a year, the hosting is not too expensive either. What ‘information’? And how does the webclient cost money?

Either way, it doesn’t total up to the thousands he is bringing in, not including the ads. I don’t mind too much about the money, I just would like to know what he’s spending it on for the community.
[/quote]

The ads cover the hosting, I pay about $350/month for this particular dedicated, and I own 4 domains we actively use, and 5 or 6 stellar-dawn related domains. Plus alternate DNS hosting, hosting for the client and cache, various stuff. But the ads basically cover all of that, and for anyone who doesn’t want to see them, I’ve always advocated the adblockplus program. Most other sites I know detect that and force you to disable it, or bug you, I don’t.

The sponsored server money I have been saving up, I haven’t actually bought anything yet because no one has submitted a server at all. Blakeman talked to me thoroughly about it, and potentially has an eligible server, but isn’t willing to sell until he tries hosting it. I also am trying to buy clients, but no one has seemed interesting in that either yet. Perhaps a tutorial or something needs made. I’m also considering offering some of the money for an updater so I can finish my bot. But it will all be used for the community in one way or the other, if you have a suggestion, I’m always open to them.[/quote]But as it was stated, doesn’t the current income from the Status Page cover any hosting cost you may have (and more)? I think a lot of people would appreciate those ads being gone. I think a few thousand dollars in the coffers might be enough savings to buy a server/client/update server.

Read full topic

you would go here

item.title: How?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:14, topic:365257”]Domain is $10 a year, the hosting is not too expensive either. What ‘information’? And how does the webclient cost money?

Either way, it doesn’t total up to the thousands he is bringing in, not including the ads. I don’t mind too much about the money, I just would like to know what he’s spending it on for the community.[/quote]

The ads cover the hosting, I pay about $350/month for this particular dedicated, and I own 4 domains we actively use, and 5 or 6 stellar-dawn related domains. Plus alternate DNS hosting, hosting for the client and cache, various stuff. But the ads basically cover all of that, and for anyone who doesn’t want to see them, I’ve always advocated the adblockplus program. Most other sites I know detect that and force you to disable it, or bug you, I don’t.

The sponsored server money I have been saving up, I haven’t actually bought anything yet because no one has submitted a server at all. Blakeman talked to me thoroughly about it, and potentially has an eligible server, but isn’t willing to sell until he tries hosting it. I also am trying to buy clients, but no one has seemed interesting in that either yet. Perhaps a tutorial or something needs made. I’m also considering offering some of the money for an updater so I can finish my bot. But it will all be used for the community in one way or the other, if you have a suggestion, I’m always open to them.

Read full topic

item.title: How?
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

It was when I was hosting my shitty devolution leech (U-Rune), I put it up when I left for school and came back and it was still on. The most online was like 50, but there wasn’t many left on by the time I got home because I had no content.

But that was a while ago, dunno how much stuff has changed since I’m not really involved in servers anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: How?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:22, topic:365257”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=461461.msg3375961#msg3375961 date=1287615445]

[quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=461461.msg3375960#msg3375960 date=1287615358]

Obviously many players use and play the other servers as well, look at all the votes and such. No one buys a sponsored position until they are already a popular server, they all get started with a free server posting.
[/quote]Where are you getting your information? I know of many servers that started out with their second month on the status page. (First month was like a beta)

They get someone willing to invest (buy the slot, get a vps, web hosting etc) in the server, get an advert slot, hire a coder, and viola! Split the donations and make some easy $$.

So to specifically answer the question:

  1. Get an investor
  2. Get a base
  3. Get a coder
  4. Get a web designer
  5. Host a 1 month beta period
  6. Investor buys status slot
  7. Enjoy your active server.

nthx not too practical imo.
[/quote]That’s exactly how they do it though, I’m serious.

I have no idea where to find an investor. I’d program it mostly myself though. But I still don’t see the success-rate to be too high even if I did.[/quote]The investor is the key part, if you have one (that can actually afford it) then your server will succeed. Unless the base is not at all stable of course…

Read full topic

So to specifically answer the question:

nthx not too practical imo.

item.title: How?
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

[quote=“ChaosPkers, post:11, topic:365257”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=461461.msg3375834#msg3375834 date=1287610603]

Obviously many players use and play the other servers as well, look at all the votes and such. No one buys a sponsored position until they are already a popular server, they all get started with a free server posting.

Alright. I see. I wasn’t trying to offend you, but I don’t get how I can obtain players nowadays. I’m just looking for practical ideas.

I’m not offended, I was just stating that many people use the server status page besides the sponsored servers.

[quote author=ChaosPkers link=topic=461461.msg3375816#msg3375816 date=1287610034]

Obviously many players use and play the other servers as well, look at all the votes and such. No one buys a sponsored position until they are already a popular server, they all get started with a free server posting.
[/quote]no your status page is shit, and you do it (sponsored servers) for you’re selfish use, admit it or not.

I only use the money for the community, not for myself, as much as I would love to.
[/quote]what have you spent it on? you’ve made quite a bit, so surely you’ve put some toward the community?

(btw im not trying to be an asshole i just think the sponsored servers shit is retarded. i think that the servers that are good deserve to be popular, not the ones that spend the most money on their server)[/quote]

Well there’s the moparscape webclient, information, the domain + hosting, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: How?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

^ I am quite curious about that myself. We all know about how you will potentially buy a good server, but as that has yet to happen, I’m curious. I think I said it before, but now with the few thousand coming in each month, why do we need the ads at the top and bottom of the page, that take people AWAY from the site? I happen to know that you receive a check each month for that, but does that go into the community fund?

Read full topic
